text: [Music]
it's one of the world's safest airliners
made to the highest standards full of
electronic equipment that tells the
ground where it is so how could an
aircraft like this simply vanish without
trace it's very unusual for an aircraft
just to disappear like this we would
normally expect the emergency location
beacon to help us find it all the
bleeping units attached to the black
boxes and the recorders to help us
locate the aircraft so it's very unusual
for it to have disappeared very quickly
the search goes on
but everything is pointing to a
catastrophic sudden breakup in midair
the flight was cruising at more than
30,000 feet so even if both engines had
failed it can glide for more than a
hundred miles
giving the pilots time to call in a
mayday in fact most problems should
leave a clue even with a with a serious
malfunction
you've normally got time the first thing
you do is concentrate on flying the
aircraft and making sure the flight path
is safe then you'll look where you're
going but then very soon off that you'll
be looking to get some communication
going getting some help from either
ground station or other aircraft it
revives memories of another tragedy Air
France flight 447 which disappeared over
the sea five years ago the clues were
eventually found years later more than
two miles underwater a combination of
mechanical issues and pilot error caused
that crash it could be months even years
before we know what's happened to this
Malaysia Airlines flight
Richard Westcott BBC news
